Question: How can I create a custom view in Android that has a button and a text view?
Answer: You can create a custom view in Android by extending the View class or one of its subclasses such as Button or TextView. Here is a simple example of a custom view that has a button and a text view:

```java
public class CustomView extends LinearLayout {
    private Button button;
    private TextView textView;

    public CustomView(Context context) {
        super(context);
        init(context);
    }

    public CustomView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs) {
        super(context, attrs);
        init(context);
    }

    public CustomView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr) {
        super(context, attrs, defStyleAttr);
        init(context);
    }

    private void init(Context context) {
        LayoutInflater.from(context).inflate(R.layout.custom_view_layout, this, true);
        button = findViewById(R.id.button);
        textView = findViewById(R.id.textView);
    }

    public void setButtonText(String text) {
        button.setText(text);
    }

    public void setTextViewText(String text) {
        textView.setText(text);
    }
}
```

In the above code, `CustomView` is a custom view that contains a button and a text view. The `init()` method is used to inflate the custom view layout and find the button and text view views. The `setButtonText()` and `setTextViewText()` methods are used to set the text of the button and text view respectively.

The `custom_view_layout.xml` file should look something like this:

```xml
<merge xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
    <Button
        android:id="@+id/button"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Button" />
    <TextView
        android:id="@+id/textView"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="TextView" />
</merge>
```

This layout file contains a button and a text view. The `merge` tag is used to include the layout of the button and text view in the custom view layout.

You can use this custom view in your layout file like this:

```xml
<com.example.app.CustomView
    android:id="@+id/customView"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content" />
```

And in your activity or fragment, you can set the text of the button and text view like this:

```java
CustomView customView = findViewById(R.id.customView);
customView.setButtonText("New Button Text");
customView.setTextViewText("New Text View Text");
```

This will set the text of the button to "New Button Text" and the text of the text view to "New Text View Text".
